physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal resting left ventricular size and systolic function with an estimated ejection fraction of 60%. Peak dynamic gradient across the LVOT was 88 mm Hg after provocation with exercise. During intraoperative transesophageal echocardiogram: no resting or provokable gradient across the LVOT, 1+ mitral regurgitation, and no systolic anterior motion of the mitral valve.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Atrial fibrillation developed on the third postoperative day but was converted to normal sinus rhythm within 24 hours. On the seventh postoperative day, transient ischemic attacks occurred with visual field disturbances. Repeated transesophageal echocardiogram showed nonmobile echo densities in the LVOT, suggestive of thrombi.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Magnetic resonance imaging showed small areas of acute ischemia in the right middle frontal gyrus and right occipital pole.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Intracavitary masses were noted but showed no change in size during follow-up Transesophageal echocardiogram. A large posterior loculated pericardial effusion with associated tamponade was noted two days later.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Evacuation of the pericardial effusion was performed and removal of 4 masses from the LVOT, all consistent with thrombi.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Clinical course stabilized without further evidence of embolic events post-reoperation.
